definition: belonging to the essential nature or constitution of a thing
examples: the intrinsic worth of a gem
the intrinsic brightness of a star

definition: being or relating to a semiconductor in which the concentration of charge carriers is characteristic of the material itself instead of the content of any impurities it contains
originating or due to causes within a body, organ, or part
